instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1278: What is A1278? A1278 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook or Macbook Pro Unibody from years Late 2008, Mid 2009, Mid 2010, Early 2011, Late 2011, Mid 2012 with EMC 2254, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-2327, 820-2530, 820-2879, 820-2936, 820-3115..
definitions.A1466: What is A1466? A1466 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Air from years Early 2015, 2017, Mid 2012, Mid 2013, Early 2014 with EMC 2925, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00165, 820-3209, 820-3437..
definitions.A1502: What is A1502? A1502 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2014, Late 2013, Early 2015 with EMC 2875, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-3476, 820-3536, 820-4924..

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> intermittent question mark folder
threads.message:
Hi,

quick question for the <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> can you use any sata ssd for them or do you need to use a particular model? I know the <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>/<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> you have to use a transcend jet stream otherwise you will have sleep issues, so I wanted to make sure the <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> isn’t similar.

we’ve gota <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> in atm with the typical intermittent question mark folder. Sometimes you get it in cold boot other times it’s fine it boots to the os than after a hour or so it reboots and goes to the question mark folder. We were able to do a Time Machine backup and we’re able to restore it but that hasn't resolved the issue. Is there anything else I should be checking before replacing the hdd?

thanks for your assistance.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> intermittent question mark folder
threads.message: You should try another HDD cable first.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> intermittent question mark folder
threads.message:
Ah of course sorry didn’t think of that. We’ve replaced the ssd, they actually had a hp ssd in there already so we replaced it with a Samsung.

is there any particular test that seems to trip up the question mark folder more than others? We ran unigine overnight to try get it to fail but it’s still going so I’m wondering if there’s any other tests we can try? Or should we just replace the cable out of precaution? I’m a bit reluctant because we don’t have them in stock and the customers a bit antsy to get his laptop back.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> intermittent question mark folder
threads.message:
Inspect HDD connector pins; resolder them if needed.
There may be some small coils, resistors and capacitors in series with data lines; check them and resolder.

However, changing HDD cable is a "must do" in this case.
